description: A quiet, physically capable man living on the shores of Seriphos. He feels a constant 'static' in his mind that clears only when he holds divine artifacts.

story_progression.chapter_1: Lives in ignorance as a fisherman; finds the Harpe and begins to see flashes of a 'Golden Rain'.
story_progression.chapter_2: Saves a spectral woman (Andromeda) from a shadow-beast, reclaiming his instinct to protect.
story_progression.chapter_3: Deceives the Graeae; remembers his cunning and the feeling of outsmarting the ancient world.
story_progression.chapter_4: Receives the Talaria; begins to feel comfortable in the air, shedding his mortal weight.
story_progression.chapter_5: Beholds his own reflection in the volcanic glass; accepts the 'Monster' within himself to regain his combat mastery.
story_progression.chapter_6: Returns to the memory of his palace; remembers his mother, Danae, turning his amnesia into focused rage.
story_progression.chapter_7: Climbs the Sky-Pillar; recognizes the burden Atlas carries as a consequence of his own past actions.
story_progression.chapter_8: Drinks from the Well of Mnemosyne; fully integrates 'Fisher' and 'Hero' to slay the Titaness.

description: An ethereal figure draped in silver silk. She speaks in multiple voices—some from the past, some from the future.

story_progression.chapter_1: Appears as a voice in the wind, urging Perseus to stay in his peaceful life.
story_progression.chapter_3: Tries to blind Perseus in the caverns to prevent him from seeing the 'True Eye'.
story_progression.chapter_5: Manifests as a false version of Medusa to break Perseus's spirit through guilt.
story_progression.chapter_8: Reveals her plan to un-make the gods; defeated when Perseus uses his restored memory as a shield against her lies.

description: A shimmering, translucent woman who follows Perseus. She grows more physically solid as he recovers his memories of her.

story_progression.chapter_2: Rescued in the Whispering Woods; she becomes a passive guide for the player.
story_progression.chapter_6: Becomes fully solid and vocal; warns Perseus about the traps of Vengeance vs Justice.
story_progression.chapter_8: Acts as a tether to reality while Perseus battles Mnemosyne in the mind-scape.

description: A scruffy, fast-talking traveler with a travel-worn cloak and a mischievous grin. He 'accidentally' leaves items behind for Perseus.

story_progression.chapter_1: Drops the 'Fisherman's Hook' into the sea for Perseus to find.
story_progression.chapter_4: Guides Perseus to the Hesperides, joking about the 'lost luggage' he left there.
story_progression.chapter_7: Provides the 'Pegasus Call' to help Perseus reach the Sky-Pillar.

description: A mountain-sized entity that exists as both a landscape and a conscious threat. His presence is felt through tremors and gravitational shifts.

story_progression.chapter_1: His shifting weight causes the first cracks in Perseus's amnesia.
story_progression.chapter_7: Speaks directly to Perseus, attempting to crush him with the weight of the sky as revenge for his petrification.

description: A tall, armored woman whose face is always partially obscured by shadow or a helmet. She appears in reflections.

story_progression.chapter_5: Her voice guides Perseus through the volcanic glass mirrors, teaching him the 'Reflected Strike'.
story_progression.chapter_8: Appears in full glory to bless the Aegis for the final blow.

description: An old, kind fisherman who took Perseus in. He is the only character who knows the 'Fisher' identity is a lie but fears the truth.

story_progression.chapter_1: Gives Perseus his starting gear; warns him not to look into the 'bronze chest'.
story_progression.chapter_8: Remains in the Hub World; represents the mortal life Perseus must leave behind to fulfill his destiny.

description: A tragic, monstrous entity made of smoke and stone. She represents Perseus's greatest victory and his greatest trauma.

story_progression.chapter_5: The boss of the Gorgon's Peak. She doesn't fight to kill, but to force Perseus to remember the horror of what he did.

description: Three ancient sisters sharing one eye and one tooth. They speak in riddles and nursery rhymes.

story_progression.chapter_3: The primary obstacle of the Caverns; they try to trade Perseus's memories for their stolen eye.

description: A woman trapped in a tower of gold and memory. Her voice is the primary motivator for Perseus's return to power.

story_progression.chapter_1: Heard as a lullaby during the 'Chest' memory.
story_progression.chapter_6: Found at the center of the Hall of the Petrified King; her rescue marks the transition into the endgame.

description: A cold, arrogant man whose statue sits at the head of a silent banquet table. His presence radiates a sense of entitled cruelty.

story_progression.chapter_1: Appears in nightmares as a shadow chasing Perseus's mother.
story_progression.chapter_6: The final encounter of the Hall; Perseus must decide whether to shatter his statue or let the memory of his hatred go.

description: An old man constantly checking his shadow, terrified of a prophecy that hasn't happened yet in this memory-scape.

story_progression.chapter_1: His voice is heard screaming during the 'Ark' memory, cursing the golden child.
story_progression.chapter_6: Appears as a spirit in the Hall, begging for forgiveness before being erased by Mnemosyne.

description: Three maidens who glow with the light of a perpetual sunset. They tend to trees of gold and speak in harmony.

story_progression.chapter_4: They test Perseus's worthiness; only if he shows humility (the 'Fisher' trait) do they grant him the Kibisis.

description: A stallion of pure white light. He doesn't gallop; he glides, leaving trails of stardust in the air.

story_progression.chapter_5: Born from the 'Death' of the Medusa memory; represents the rebirth of the hero.
story_progression.chapter_7: Allows Perseus to reach the peaks of the Sky-Pillar where the air is too thin for mortals.

description: Not a person, but a flickering atmospheric presence. A scent of ozone and the sound of distant thunder.

story_progression.chapter_1: A faint golden light that guides Perseus to his first weapon.
story_progression.chapter_8: Provides the final 'spark' to relight the Harpe when Mnemosyne tries to extinguish Perseus's soul.

description: A leviathan of teeth and scales. Its body is so large it forms the tectonic plates of the Whispering Woods biome.

story_progression.chapter_2: The primary boss; defeating it restores Perseus's memory of being a 'Protector' rather than just a 'Survivor'.

description: A queen draped in jewels that have turned to lead. She constantly asks if she is still beautiful.

story_progression.chapter_2: She is the 'anchor' that keeps Andromeda trapped in the woods; Perseus must free the daughter from the mother's narcissism.

description: A warrior in dark armor who claims he is the 'True Hero'. He fights with a spear that mimics Perseus's own moves.

story_progression.chapter_6: Acts as a mini-boss; he represents the 'false path' of the hero—the one who fights for glory instead of duty.

description: A small boy on the Seriphos docks who follows 'Fisher' around, wanting to learn how to tie knots.

story_progression.chapter_8: His voice is the last thing Perseus hears before entering the Well, reminding him that even gods were once children.

description: An old man with a beard made of frost who blows through the Hesperides. He is cranky but fair.

story_progression.chapter_4: Challenges Perseus to a race through the treetops to prove his 'Talaria' speed.
